# GitHub Copilot Setup

This repository is configured with GitHub Copilot with all authorizations enabled.

## What's Enabled

### Core Features
- ✅ Code completions and suggestions
- ✅ Copilot Chat for interactive coding assistance
- ✅ Pull request summaries
- ✅ Commit message suggestions
- ✅ Code review assistance
- ✅ Documentation generation
- ✅ Test generation
- ✅ Code explanation

### Authorizations
- ✅ Full repository access
- ✅ All file types supported
- ✅ All programming languages supported
- ✅ Public code suggestions enabled
- ✅ Organization-wide suggestions (if applicable)
- ✅ Training data access for better suggestions

### Advanced Features
- ✅ Inline suggestions
- ✅ Panel suggestions
- ✅ Comment-to-code generation
- ✅ Code-to-comment generation
- ✅ Multi-line suggestions
- ✅ Whole function generation
- ✅ CLI integration
- ✅ IDE integration (VS Code, JetBrains, Neovim, etc.)
- ✅ Web editor integration
- ✅ Workspace analysis
- ✅ Cross-file context
- ✅ Project-wide analysis

### User Permissions
- ✅ All collaborators can use Copilot
- ✅ External contributors can use Copilot
- ✅ Organization members can use Copilot (if applicable)

### Experimental Features
- ✅ Beta features enabled
- ✅ Experimental AI models enabled
- ✅ Advanced context analysis enabled

## How to Use

### Prerequisites
1. Ensure you have an active GitHub Copilot subscription
2. Install the GitHub Copilot extension in your editor:
   - **VS Code**: Install "GitHub Copilot" extension
   - **JetBrains IDEs**: Install "GitHub Copilot" plugin
   - **Neovim**: Install the Copilot plugin
   - **Other editors**: Check GitHub Copilot documentation

### Getting Started
1. Clone this repository
2. Open it in your editor with Copilot installed
3. Start coding - Copilot will automatically provide suggestions
4. Use `Ctrl+Enter` (or `Cmd+Enter` on Mac) to see more suggestions
5. Use the Copilot Chat feature for interactive assistance

### Copilot Chat Commands
- `/explain` - Explain selected code
- `/fix` - Suggest fixes for problems
- `/tests` - Generate tests
- `/help` - Show available commands
- Ask any coding question naturally

### Pull Request Integration
When creating pull requests, Copilot will automatically:
- Generate PR summaries
- Suggest code improvements
- Identify potential issues
- Recommend tests

## Configuration Files

- `.github/copilot-usage-policy.yml` - Main Copilot policy configuration
- `.github/copilot.yml` - Additional Copilot settings

## Privacy and Security

This repository has telemetry and usage data sharing enabled to improve Copilot suggestions. Code suggestions may include matches from public code.

If you have privacy concerns:
1. Review the configuration files
2. Adjust settings in your personal Copilot settings
3. Contact the repository maintainers
